alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 1:13PM PST until March 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1000 feet, snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills. This includes Highway 138 and especially around Toketee Falls and Steamboat. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
